alert.note: Alert for Lyon (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 12 at 11:34AM PDT until March 15 at 3:30AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Nevada... Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane affecting Lyon County. .Flood waters from local inflows to the East Walker River below Bridgeport reservoir, in combination with elevated flows on the West Walker River are making their way into Mason Valley and Yerington areas. Minor flooding will also impact the lower Walker River through Wabuska to Weber Reservoir. For the Mainstem Walker River...including Mason at Snyder Lane... Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Walker River Near Mason at Snyder Lane. * WHEN...Until Wednesday Morning. * IMPACTS...At 10.3 feet, Minor flooding of lowlands, pasture and farmland in Mason Valley-Yerington area. Preventative sandbagging of lowest homes and businesses adjacent to river should begin if further rises are possible. Some flooding of rural roads. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:05 AM PDT Sunday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage this afternoon to a crest of 10.3 feet late this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late tomorrow afternoon. - Flood stage is 9.8 feet. - Flood History...This crest is expected to near the 6/6/2017 crest of 10.2` but below the 6/22/2017 crest of 10.94` - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued Monday morning by 1130 AM PDT.
